meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: LIFESTYLES OF THE RICH AND FAMOUS

div.a: The Very Real Perils Of Rich Kids On Social Networks

div.div: Michael Dell pays about $2.7 million a year for the security protection of his family, according to Dell regulatory filings. And so you can imagine how pleased he must have been to see his children’s jaunt to Fiji detailed on a catchy website and his daughter providing an online diary of her life, replete with GPS locations dished out by her cell phone.

div.a: Good lessons in here for all parents: Read: The Very Real Perils of Rich Kids on Social Networks

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NeZPxy&via=Digg&text=The Very Real Perils Of Rich Kids On Social Networks

div.div: Inspired by the mountain of YouTube covers of his hit, "Somebody That I Used To Know," Gotye claims he "couldn't resist the massive remixability that such a large, varied yet connected bundle of source material offered. " Enjoy!

div.a: This is probably the only time that Gotye song will ever be okay.

div.div: BECAUSE WE'VE ALREADY SOLVED ALL THE NON-FICTION MYSTERIES

div.a: A Scientific Explanation Of Harry Potter's 'Wizarding Gene'

div.div: How is the wizarding gene passed down? One Potter fan offers up an explanation.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SbVeZo&via=Digg&text=A Scientific Explanation Of Harry Potter's 'Wizarding Gene'

div.a: U.S. Female Olympians Have Won More Medal Points Than All But Four Countries

div.div: American women are crushing it at the Olympics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RCxfVP&via=Digg&text=U.S. Female Olympians Have Won More Medal Points Than All But Four Countries

div.a: Sleep Your Way To The Top: How Sleep Equals Success

div.div: A growing number of research studies suggest that sleep may be the secret to performing at your highest level, writes David K. Randall. Everyone from the military to athletes are starting to get serious about sleep.

div.a: A morning eye-opener: Sleep Your Way to the Top: How Sleep Equals Success … via @thedailybeast

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SaWMTq&via=Digg&text=Sleep Your Way To The Top: How Sleep Equals Success

div.a: The Koch Brothers Tangle With Zach Galifianakis

div.div: If I may pause for a moment and directly address the Koch brothers: Boys: Chuckles, Davey, you don't attack a comedian. You should've called me. I would have told you that you can't win. (See Stewart, Jon, on Crossfire. Oh wait, you can't. Crossfire was canceled—because Jon Stewart killed it.)

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QpOSnX&via=Digg&text=The Koch Brothers Tangle With Zach Galifianakis

div.div: Consumers are being warned that the price of bacon will rise significantly next year as European producers quit the industry ahead of new laws governing animal welfare.

div.a: Is App.Net The Beginning Of 'White Flight' From Facebook And Twitter?

div.div: "I’m now wondering if App.net doesn’t mark the beginning of 'white flight' from Twitter and Facebook, just as danah boyd has argued that Facebook was the “white flight” from Myspace before that."

div.a: Really great article on what is essentially the "gentrification" of The Internet with …

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MI1oEm&via=Digg&text=Is App.Net The Beginning Of 'White Flight' From Facebook And Twitter?

div.a: How Big Data Became So Big

div.div: This has been the crossover year for Big Data — as a concept, as a term and, yes, as a marketing tool. Big Data has sprung from the confines of technology circles into the mainstream.

div.a: “Big Data is a tagline for a process that has the potential to transform everything.”

div.div: Today Google has their final logo for the Olympics, the London 2012 closing ceremony logo (aka Doodle).

div.a: 8,000 Departing Olympians To Create Havoc At Heathrow

div.div: London’s Heathrow airport will operate a special terminal for 8,000 departing Olympians as the busiest day for Games travel brings 22 percent more passengers than usual through Europe’s biggest hub.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PP5uon&via=Digg&text=8,000 Departing Olympians To Create Havoc At Heathrow

div.a: NBC Confuses Jesse Eisenberg For Zuckerberg

div.div: Actor Jesse Eisenberg played Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg in a movie. He must have done a really good job, because it seems lots of people think he really is Mark Zuckerberg.

div.a: How Lasers Make The Modern Pentathlon More Modern

div.div: One of the coolest sports ever has gotten a little cooler with the addition of … laser pistols.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RBp4Js&via=Digg&text=How Lasers Make The Modern Pentathlon More Modern

div.a: NYPD Fatally Shoots Knife-Wielding Man In Times Square

div.div: The suspect was originally approached when he was spotted smoking what appeared to be marijuana. When confronted by officers, he drew an 11-inch knife.

div.a: "They gonna shoot you, boy" Watch The Fatal Confrontation Btw Knife-Wielding Man And Cops In Times Square … @Gothamist

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QrxXBl&via=Digg&text=NYPD Fatally Shoots Knife-Wielding Man In Times Square

div.a: How Romney And Ryan Outwitted The 24-Hour News Cycle

div.div: On Friday, after a day of work, Rep. Paul Ryan pretended to turn in for the night, letting reporters observe him walk through the front door of his home in Wisconsin. A short time later, he snuck out the back door and through the woods, heading for a spot on the Republican ticket.

div.a: "Skulduggery" is, honestly, a word I'd love to see more use of in political reporting. Well done, NYT.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NpQeSN&via=Digg&text=How Romney And Ryan Outwitted The 24-Hour News Cycle
